subject: Not getting 100% travel when using Simhub
description_text:
Hi Team,
I have the SIMSONN PRO Sim Racing Pedals PC Racing Simulator Pedals
Pressure Sensor 200KG Load Cell Brake Pedal HE Hydraulic Pedal Black
(P3-H3). Perched May 2024. I have upgraded to the Plus X Control Box to
allow me to use your VAM Pro Linear Motors.

Using your Simsonn Manager v2.1.2 software my Pedals show as SIMSONN Plus X
(CPU1:v2.0.5 CPU2:v2.0.4).
[image: image.png]
There are many issues with games I have tested where the VAM motors lock up
and constantly rumble after just 10 to 15 minutes requiring me to
disconnect the power to stop them.
For this reason and also the additional options I am using Simhub. The
issue I am having in Simhub is that it does appear to recognize the pedals
calibration. The Break start dead zone is ignored, this is easily tweaked
in game but only happens when using Simhub. But the issue I am
struggling most with is my Throttle will not go to 100% in game when fully
pressed. In games where I can adjust the end deadzone I can dial it out but
It needs adjusting constantly. For games that dont have this setting I have
tried using linearity but this reduces the pedal throw a lot and is not a
solution.

Do you have any solution for me to get my pedals working with Simhub. My
friend is using Simhub with his Simsonn Pro X Ultra pedals and is not
having the same issues.
Thanks.

conversations.body_text: Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi
My PC is fully grounded and I have never had emi issues. I have connected
the control box to the pedals with a ground wire and it has made no
difference to the issue where my Throttle does not register 100% in games
even though its properly calibrated in the Simsonn Manager software.
Please see clips attached
 unknown_2025.12.30-20.03_clip_1.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iF3xW8wpJfJ_HDOosr2ABMYz9np8bQrj/view?usp=drive_web>
.

On Tue, 30 Dec 2025 at 07:38, service@simsonn.com
Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  The key point here is to use a wire to connect the PC case (chassis) to one of the screws on the control box (grounding). This can effectively resolve the disconnection issue.

I am not reporting a disconnection issue, are you not reading my emails?
look at the video clips you will see the issue I am reporting.

On Wed, 31 Dec 2025 at 01:29, service@simsonn.com

Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  Please uninstall SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.2 from your computer first, then download and install SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.3 from our official website.  SIMSONN Manager 2.1.3 includes optimizations for the vibration function. Please test again using this version.  https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

Okay I will uninstall 2.1.2 and install 2.1.3. and let you know how it goes.

On Wed, 7 Jan 2026 at 15:18, service@simsonn.com

unknown_2026.01.07-22.58.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/19VtvxWEwY48o-7PQdTDHVB7LC9e9PBgt/view?usp=drive_web>
I am now running 2.1.3 and I still have the issue. See the attached video,
the throttle never goes to 100% and the break is on all the time.

On Wed, 7 Jan 2026 at 21:59, Derek Ofori-Atta <derek.oforiatta@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Okay I will uninstall 2.1.2 and install 2.1.3. and let you know how it
> goes.
>
> On Wed, 7 Jan 2026 at 15:18, service@simsonn.com

Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  If it still doesn’t work, you can install ToDesk, and I can assist you remotely to check and resolve the issue. No registration is required—just provide the connection ID and the temporary access code.

Okay when can we do the ToDesk session?

On Thu, 8 Jan 2026 at 02:20, service@simsonn.com

Am I going to get an answer? I have tried everything you have suggested and
the issue still persists. I am ready to do the ToDesk session if that is
what it takes.

On Sun, 11 Jan 2026 at 19:30, Derek Ofori-Atta <derek.oforiatta@gmail.com>
wrote:

> Okay when can we do the ToDesk session?
>
> On Thu, 8 Jan 2026 at 02:20, service@simsonn.com

Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  We recommend installing the VAM Pro using nylon screws and nylon washers. This is to electrically isolate the VAM Pro from the motor bracket, which helps reduce/avoid interference carried through the bracket and prevents the VAM Pro from affecting the pedal signal.

What size screws and washers do i need?

On Thu, 15 Jan 2026 at 01:44, service@simsonn.com
Hi Derek Ofori-Atta,  M3 nylon screws and M3 nylon washers/spacers. If they’re not included in your accessory kit, we can send you a replacement set.

No I did not get any nylon screws or washers, I did use the fiber washers
that were included. So yes please send me a set.

On Sat, 17 Jan 2026 at 05:09, service@simsonn.com
